summary: This is an email chain from November 2019 discussing case updates among prosecutors. It mentions a meeting in California with a victim who is uncertain about pursuing a criminal case, the inability to bring an enticement charge, and ongoing work on memos including an LLC memo. It also notes an upcoming limited proffer session with another individual.

connections.description: They are communicating about case updates, scheduling meetings, and coordinating on legal memos related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Meeting in California with victim
events.description: A meeting was held in California with a victim who is uncertain about pursuing a criminal case and did not want to discuss specific conduct; it was determined an enticement charge could not be brought.

events.title: Upcoming limited proffer session
events.description: An individual is scheduled to come in for a limited proffer session to talk about her background.

keyFacts: Prosecutors determined they 'almost certainly couldn't bring an enticement charge' based on timing and location facts from a meeting with a victim.
A victim met in California was still unsure about pursuing a criminal case and did not want to discuss specific conduct at that meeting.
Prosecutors were working on a 'pile of memos,' including an 'LLC memo' expected that week.
An individual was scheduled for a 'limited proffer' session to discuss her background starting a week from Tuesday (November 26, 2019).
The email chain shows ongoing coordination among prosecutors on the Epstein case in November 2019, including scheduling challenges.
